title: XY-Wing
description: Master chain-based elimination using the XY-Wing pattern

steps.title: Chain Logic
steps.content:
Learn **XY-Wing** - a chain-based elimination technique.

**What You'll Learn:**
- XY-Wing structure (pivot + 2 pincers)
- How chains create elimination
- Finding and applying XY-Wings

**Time Estimate:** 35 minutes

steps.title: XY-Wing Pattern
steps.content:
**XY-Wing Structure:**
- **Pivot cell**: Has candidates {X, Y}
- **Pincer 1**: Has candidates {X, Z} - shares X with pivot
- **Pincer 2**: Has candidates {Y, Z} - shares Y with pivot

**The Logic:**
If pivot is X ‚Üí Pincer 1 must be Z
If pivot is Y ‚Üí Pincer 2 must be Z
Either way, one pincer will be Z.

**Elimination:**
Any cell that SEES both pincers cannot be Z.

**Example:**
- Pivot R5C5: {2, 7}
- Pincer R5C2: {2, 9}
- Pincer R3C5: {7, 9}

If R5C5=2 ‚Üí R5C2=9
If R5C5=7 ‚Üí R3C5=9
Therefore: Cell that sees both R5C2 and R3C5 cannot be 9.

**Requirements:**
- Exactly 3 cells with 2 candidates each
- Pivot connects to both pincers
- Pincers share one candidate (Z)
- Target cell sees both pincers

steps.title: Practice XY-Wing
steps.content:
Find and apply XY-Wing patterns.

**Goal:** Complete at least 2 of 3 puzzles

puzzles.title: Basic XY-Wing
hints: Look for pivot cell connected to 2 pincers
Eliminate from cells seeing both pincers

questions.question: What is the XY-Wing structure?
options: Pivot cell with 2 pincers, sharing candidates through chain logic
questions.explanation: XY-Wing has a pivot cell {X,Y} connected to two pincers {X,Z} and {Y,Z}, forming a logical chain.

questions.question: In an XY-Wing, where do you eliminate?
options: From cells that see BOTH pincers
questions.explanation: Eliminate the shared pincer digit (Z) from any cell that can see BOTH pincers, because one of them must be Z.

questions.question: Why is XY-Wing more complex than X-Wing?
options: XY-Wing uses chain logic, X-Wing uses pattern logic
XY-Wing only works in hard puzzles
questions.explanation: XY-Wing uses logical chains (if-then reasoning) while X-Wing uses spatial patterns. Different approaches to elimination.
